most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
Can't turn on long term memory engine
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
CTRL + V (Super + V) Doesn't work for Screenshots

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Launching and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch from various applications or system tray, often accompanied by error messages. This might involve the OS toolbar not appearing, extensions failing to connect, or the app getting stuck. Proposed solutions include updating Pieces OS and related extensions, checking for conflicts, and debugging OS errors related to applets or port selection.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@claire-at-pieces) reported an issue with icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces support bot.
* Related issues and resources were suggested to the user.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is seeing icons in the corner of the copilot.
* It is unclear if this is a bug or intended behavior.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mason-at-pieces from the Pieces team confirmed that the icons are a known feature and should be appearing.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user confirmed that the explanation by @mason-at-pieces resolves the issue.
* The issue is considered closed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user did not provide the content of the video they originally posted.
* The icons appearing in the corner of the copilot is a known feature and not a bug.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @johnkennyuk requested the ability to create multi-line code blocks in scripts.
* Author @caleb-at-pieces acknowledged the request and confirmed its value.

**Problems Identified:**

* Currently, code blocks in scripts are limited to single lines.
* This can be a limitation for creating complex scripts.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @caleb-at-pieces confirmed the feature will be added to the internal project board.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The feature is planned for a future release of Pieces OS.

**Additional Notes:**

* @johnkennyuk noted that any code block should support multiple lines, not just code blocks with a single line.
* The timeframe for the release is not specified in the conversation.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points Raised

* @Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the OS toolbar from various points (Visual Studio, desktop app, OS app itself, etc.)
* @sam-at-pieces found two Sentry issues related to the OS server toolbar not launching correctly.
* @robert-at-pieces initially suspected the issue was related to the Visual Studio plugin but later found it to be tangential.
* The issue appears to be caused by an OS error when trying to host applets.

### Problems Identified

* OS toolbar is not launching correctly.
* Unclear whether the two Sentry issues are related.
* Visual Studio plugin issue might be tangential.
* Underlying cause of the OS error is unknown.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented

* Hotfix released for Visual Studio plugin (version 3.0.1) to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to port selection for tool window integrations.

### Current Status/Outcome

* Problem persists after updating VS extension and Pieces OS.
* Clicking the icon in the system tray does nothing.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own occasionally.
* A debugging session with @Andrea3i is scheduled to further investigate the issue.
* Possible causes of the OS error are being investigated.

## Important Details

* Initial issue identified by @sam-at-pieces with Sentry issues.
* @robert-at-pieces pinpointed the issue to an OS error but the specific cause is unknown.
* Several potential causes are being investigated, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and permission issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report white screens, connection problems, and application crashes with Pieces OS and Desktop App on Windows. Troubleshooting includes reinstalling, updating to the latest version, and examining log files. Some issues persist, requiring further investigation and potential bug fixes.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @jiaweing encountered a white screen in the Pieces Desktop Application.
* The issue persisted for @ubranch and @JeffreyMJohnson.
* @ubranch decided to stop using Pieces due to the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* White screen in the Pieces Desktop Application.
* Potential performance issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces suggested sharing the local folder related to the Desktop App.
* @mack-at-pieces suggested re-installing the latest version (3.1.0) of the desktop app.
* @mack-at-pieces offered to troubleshoot live with users experiencing the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be ongoing for some users.
* @mack-at-pieces is available to troubleshoot with users who are experiencing the white screen.

**Additional Notes:**

* @ubranch expressed dissatisfaction with the Flutter framework for Windows tools.

**Overall, the conversation highlights an ongoing issue with the white screen in the Pieces Desktop Application. While solutions have been proposed, the problem persists for some users.**

related_issues.title: Not Working
related_issues.text:
Not Working
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

Latest 

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99814116-7444-4cb0-8666-86b81dd9f580)
Its Keep on showing connecting and its not getting connected and it gets stck
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Ganesh-2-4 encountered an issue with the Pieces app.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue is not explicitly stated, but @Ganesh-2-4 likely experienced an error as they are directed to send logs for investigation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @rosie-at-pieces suggests sending logs located at Documents > com.pieces.os to support@pieces.app for analysis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as the conversation ends with the request for logs. 
* It is unclear whether @Ganesh-2-4 sent the logs or received further assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Long Term Memory Engine Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting difficulties enabling or connecting to the Pieces OS Long Term Memory (LTM) engine. The issue manifests as either an unresponsive button or a persistent "connecting" status. Proposed solutions include checking for updates, ensuring the LTM feature is enabled, and reviewing log files for error messages.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS crashes or fails to connect
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing when launching or failing to connect.  Issues appear on both Windows and Linux and may stem from GTK or OS server errors.  Solutions include investigating logs, updating Pieces OS and related extensions, and examining potential firewall or permission issues.

related_issues.title: Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
related_issues.text:
Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When clicking the menu point "Discover Integrations" the pieces os crashes after a few seconds and needs to be restarted.

Menu: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/ee50cf5a-c02b-481f-af39-df96bd214437)
System Details: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/27dabc03-a33e-4b59-b496-86f532c8a56e)

## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS Crash on "Discover Integrations" Button Click

**Problem:** Pieces OS crashes upon clicking the "Discover Integrations" button. This issue has been confirmed by both the user (@Idrinth) and a Pieces team member (@nathan-courtney-pieces).

**Key Points:**

* The user provided logs from 3 different dates, none of which revealed any obvious errors.
* The app crashes consistently every time the button is clicked.
* The Pieces team member acknowledges the issue and identifies it as a possible GTK issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigate the provided logs for any potential errors.
* Identify the root cause of the crash, which is suspected to be related to GTK.
* Implement a fix for the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently under investigation.
* No solution has been implemented yet.
* The Pieces team will provide an update once a fix is available.

[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points Raised

* @Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the OS toolbar from various points (Visual Studio, desktop app, OS app itself, etc.)
* @sam-at-pieces found two Sentry issues related to the OS server toolbar not launching correctly.
* @robert-at-pieces initially suspected the issue was related to the Visual Studio plugin but later found it to be tangential.
* The issue appears to be caused by an OS error when trying to host applets.

### Problems Identified

* OS toolbar is not launching correctly.
* Unclear whether the two Sentry issues are related.
* Visual Studio plugin issue might be tangential.
* Underlying cause of the OS error is unknown.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented

* Hotfix released for Visual Studio plugin (version 3.0.1) to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released with changes to port selection for tool window integrations.

### Current Status/Outcome

* Problem persists after updating VS extension and Pieces OS.
* Clicking the icon in the system tray does nothing.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own occasionally.
* A debugging session with @Andrea3i is scheduled to further investigate the issue.
* Possible causes of the OS error are being investigated.

## Important Details

* Initial issue identified by @sam-at-pieces with Sentry issues.
* @robert-at-pieces pinpointed the issue to an OS error but the specific cause is unknown.
* Several potential causes are being investigated, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and permission issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and other applications, particularly Firefox and Visual Studio, on Windows. Issues include nested processes, launching failures, and communication errors. Proposed solutions involve investigating process handling, port selection, and potential conflicts with specific Windows builds.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* TSCarterJr reported an issue where Firefox instances are spawned as nested processes within the Pieces for Developers app on Windows 11.
* This issue only occurs after a restart and within the Pieces app.
* The issue appears to be specific to Windows Insider Preview builds.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firefox instances are not launching independently, causing conflicts and potential instability.
* The issue is specific to certain Windows builds, limiting its impact.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Nathan-courtney-pieces confirmed the issue and committed to investigating the cause on Windows Insider Preview builds.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated and a fix is yet to be implemented.
* The issue only affects users on Windows Insider Preview builds.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was first reported on June 24, 2024.
* The user provided detailed information about their system and the issue.
* The issue has been confirmed by another user.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

Not Working
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest 

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99814116-7444-4cb0-8666-86b81dd9f580)
Its Keep on showing connecting and its not getting connected and it gets stck
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Ganesh-2-4 encountered an issue with the Pieces app.

**Problems Identified:**

* The issue is not explicitly stated, but @Ganesh-2-4 likely experienced an error as they are directed to send logs for investigation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @rosie-at-pieces suggests sending logs located at Documents > com.pieces.os to support@pieces.app for analysis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved as the conversation ends with the request for logs. 
* It is unclear whether @Ganesh-2-4 sent the logs or received further assistance.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS launch and connectivity issues:** These issues are the most frequent and impact multiple applications, causing significant user disruption.
**Investigate and address LTM engine connection problems:** This emerging issue is causing user frustration and requires prompt attention.
**Improve communication and documentation for LTM and connectivity troubleshooting:** Provide clear steps for users to check for updates, enable features, and interpret log files.
**Focus on Windows compatibility and integration issues:** Many reported problems occur on Windows, suggesting a need for focused testing and potential bug fixes.
**Investigate potential conflicts with Firefox and Visual Studio:** Address the nested process and communication errors observed with these applications.
**Review and optimize GTK implementation on Linux:** Address crashes and errors related to GTK to improve Linux user experience.
**Consider adding line wrapping settings for VS Code Copilot:** This feature request, while not critical, can enhance user experience and code readability.
**Continue monitoring and addressing issues with high activity levels:** Track tickets like #509, #474, and #258 to ensure timely resolution and user satisfaction.
